item.title: By: Russell Heimlich
item.dc:creator: Russell Heimlich
item.description: Yup, pretty much just layered the images on top of each other and then erased parts on the top two layers that I didn’t need. I did a little bit of blurring around the edges to help the whole thing mesh a little better. To finish it off I flattened the image and did some image adjustments to make the colors pop.
item.content:encoded: Yup, pretty much just layered the images on top of each other and then erased parts on the top two layers that I didn’t need. I did a little bit of blurring around the edges to help the whole thing mesh a little better. To finish it off I flattened the image and did some image adjustments to make the colors pop.

item.title: By: stephen
item.dc:creator: stephen
item.description: hey, saw your shots on facebook. best use of cloning ever with that first shot--truly impressive. did you just layer mask the background and superimpose the shots?
item.content:encoded: hey, saw your shots on facebook. best use of cloning ever with that first shot–truly impressive. did you just layer mask the background and superimpose the shots?
